SEARCH
Package controller

Class ManagementController

java.lang.Object
controller.ManagementController
All Implemented Interfaces:
BaseController
public class ManagementController extends Object implements BaseController
ManagementController is the main JavaFX controller responsible for the administrative interface in the BPARK system. This controller handles the UI logic and server interaction for management-level users, including managers and attendants. It provides tools for: User authentication and role-based access control (manager vs attendant). Viewing and managing subscriber details and active parking sessions. Registering new subscribers with client-side validation. Generating visual reports. Password reset requests for employees. Screen navigation and history using a managed navigation stack. All UI updates are safely executed on the JavaFX Application Thread using Platform.runLater(Runnable). This class follows the singleton pattern to allow global access via getInstance(). It also implements the BaseController interface for consistency across controller types.

      public static ManagementController getInstance()

      Returns:
      the current ManagementController instance.

    • showLoginScreen

      public void showLoginScreen()
      Navigates directly to the login screen. Clears the navigation stack to reset the navigation history.

    • getConsoleParkingDetails

      public javafx.scene.control.TextArea getConsoleParkingDetails()
      Returns the TextArea used to display parking details in the management UI. This is typically used to show search results or status messages related to active parking.
      Returns:
      The TextArea displaying parking details.

    • displaySubscriberInfo

      public void displaySubscriberInfo(String info)
      Displays subscriber information in the member details text area. Ensures the update runs on the JavaFX Application Thread.
      Parameters:
      info - The formatted subscriber information string to display.

    • showPopup

      public void showPopup(String message)
      Displays a styled popup alert with a given message. The popup uses centered text, fixed size, and no icon or alert type (other than a close button) for a neutral and consistent user experience. It is used throughout the management UI to notify the user about actions, validation results, or server-related feedback.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to display in the popup alert

    • clearRegisterMemberForm

      public void clearRegisterMemberForm()
      Clears all input fields in the "Register New Member" form.

    • handleLoginManagementResponse

      public void handleLoginManagementResponse(String response)
      Handles the response from the server after a management user attempts to log in. Parses the response to determine whether the login was successful and which role (e.g., "manager" or "attendant") the user has. Based on the role, it configures the UI appropriately and displays the management menu view. Expected response format: - "LOGIN_Management_SUCCESS|manager" - "LOGIN_Management_SUCCESS|attendant" - or simply "LOGIN_Management_FAILURE"
      Parameters:
      response - the response string received from the server

    • displayActiveParkingDetails

      public void displayActiveParkingDetails(List<ActiveParking> records)
      Displays a detailed list of active parking records in a structured format. Each record is shown as a multi-line list for readability.
      Parameters:
      records - The list of matching active parking records.

    • handlePasswordResetResponse

      public void handlePasswordResetResponse(PasswordResetResponse resp)
      Processes the server’s response to a password reset request and updates the UI accordingly. This method must be called on the JavaFX Application Thread; wrapping via Platform.runLater ensures thread safety when modifying UI controls.
      Parameters:
      resp - the PasswordResetResponse object containing: success – true if the reset email was sent successfully, false otherwise message – the feedback text to display to the user

    • displaySiteActivity

      public void displaySiteActivity(List<Reservation> future, List<ActiveParking> active)
      Displays site activity data including future reservations and active parkings in a structured text format within the management interface.
      Parameters:
      future - List of future Reservation records.
      active - List of currently active ActiveParking records.

    • displayParkingDurationBarChart

      public void displayParkingDurationBarChart(List<ParkingDurationRecord> records)
      Displays a stacked bar chart showing actual parking time, late time, and extended time per day of the month. Durations are converted from minutes to hours with one decimal precision.
      Parameters:
      records - List of ParkingDurationRecord containing daily parking metrics

    • displayMemberStatusBarChart

      public void displayMemberStatusBarChart(List<DailySubscriberCount> records)
      Displays a bar chart showing the number of subscribers who parked each day of the month.
      Parameters:
      records - List of DailySubscriberCount representing how many subscribers parked per day

    • displayParkingHistory

      public void displayParkingHistory(List<ParkingHistory> historyList)
      Displays the parking history of a subscriber in the management interface.
      Parameters:
      historyList - The list of ParkingHistory records to show.
